caption: Table 1: Results on ablation studies.
description: This table presents the results of ablation studies conducted on the MuDI model.  It shows the impact of removing key components of the model, such as the Seg-Mix augmentation, the initialization method, and the use of descriptive classes. The D&C-DS and D&C-DINO metrics measure multi-subject fidelity, showing the performance drop when each component is removed.  The results highlight the importance of each component for achieving high multi-subject fidelity.

caption: Table 2: Quantitative results on multi-subject fidelity and text fidelity. † denotes the text fidelity score considering the permutation of the subjects in the prompt to avoid position bias.
description: This table presents a quantitative comparison of MuDI against several baseline methods across two key aspects: multi-subject fidelity and text fidelity. Multi-subject fidelity is assessed using two metrics: D&C-DS and D&C-DINO. Text fidelity is evaluated using ImageReward and CLIPs.  Higher scores indicate better performance. The † symbol indicates that text fidelity scores were adjusted to avoid bias from the order of subjects in prompts.
